Adam:

Is this a recovered crawl Adam?  It looks like the stacktrace given in 
the '2006-08-15 09:22' comment in this issue: 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1533571&group_id=73833&atid=539099.   
There, the problem was that we'd moved to use a new feature in bdbje, 
deferred writes, but at checkpoint time we weren't forcing write of 
in-memory state -- so recovers were finding the bdb queues db in an 
indeterminate state.   But odd is that you were crawling fine -- 
seemingly -- and then it went haywire.  Is your machine healthy?  
Nothing in syslog about disks going bad perhaps corrupting bdb dbs?

St.Ack


goblin_cz wrote:
>
> Hallo,
> I have used heritrix for domain crawl whole czech domain. Everything
> run okay, but yesterday it throw this exception (200 000x) and now is
> paused. What can it be?
>
> peekItem failure; retrying (in thread 'ToeThread #96: ')
>
> Exception:
>
> com.sleepycat.je.DatabaseException: (JE 3.0.12) bdb queue cap missing
> Stacktrace: com.sleepycat.je.DatabaseException: (JE 3.0.12) bdb queue
> cap missing
> at
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbMultipleWorkQueues.getNextNearestItem(BdbMultipleWorkQueues.java:290)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbMultipleWorkQueues.get(BdbMultipleWorkQueues.java:254)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbWorkQueue.peekItem(BdbWorkQueue.java:107)
> at org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueue.peek(WorkQueue.java:135)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueueFrontier.replenishSessionBalance(WorkQueueFrontier.java:743)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueueFrontier.activateInactiveQueue(WorkQueueFrontier.java:711)
> at
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueueFrontier.next(WorkQueueFrontier.java:613)
> at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:146)
>
> I am using:
> Heritrix 1.9.0-200608242232
> Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition 1.5.0_08-b03
> Linux 2.4.25
>
> Thank you and have a nice day.
> Adam B.
